title: Toronto 24-6 Featherstone: Canadian club clinch place in Super League
text:
Brian McDermott could not hide his delight after Toronto completed their fairytale rise by winning promotion to Super League.

The Wolfpack were only formed three seasons ago but this famous success took them into the promised land and encouraged hopes of major expansion for rugby league.

McDermott, who won four Grand Finals during his time at Leeds and remains the most successful coach in Super League history, said: 'Toronto going up is brilliant and is just a different story because the experience here is just out of this world.

Toronto Wolfpack won promotion to Super League after overcoming Featherstone Rovers

'It's a special day for sure and you can't ignore what's going on here. We want to have a higher profile now.'

McDermott will relish being in the top flight in 2020 as Toronto face the big-boys of the British game and take games on the road to cities such as Dublin, Copenhagen, London and Barcelona.

Toronto have lost only once all year but part-timers Featherstone threatened a major upset.

Tries from Josh McCrone, Blake Wallace, Bodene Thompson and Joe Mellor set up victory

Alex Sutcliffe scored to put them 6-4 ahead at the break after Josh McCrone notched for Toronto.

The Wolfpack made their class pay in the second half as Blake Wallace, Bodene Thompson and Joe Mellor secured a place alongside Super League's elite.

authors: Ross Heppenstall For The Mail On Sunday
